description: Retrieves the details of the specified response plan.

parameters.name: arn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.

nested_items.name: actions
nested_items.description: The actions that this response plan takes at the beginning of the incident.

nested_items.name: ssmAutomation
nested_items.description: The Systems Manager automation document to start as the runbook at the beginning of the incident.

nested_items.name: documentName
nested_items.description: The automation document's name.

nested_items.name: documentVersion
nested_items.description: The automation document's version to use when running.

nested_items.name: dynamicParameters
nested_items.description: The key-value pair to resolve dynamic parameter values when processing a Systems Manager Automation runbook.

nested_items.name: variable
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: variable
nested_items.description: Variable dynamic parameters. A parameter value is determined when an incident is created.

nested_items.name: parameters
nested_items.description: The key-value pair parameters to use when running the automation document.
(string) ---
(list) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that the automation document will assume when running commands.

nested_items.name: targetAccount
nested_items.description: The account that the automation document will be run in. This can be in either the management account or an application account.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the response plan.

nested_items.name: chatChannel
nested_items.description: The Chatbot chat channel used for collaboration during an incident.

nested_items.name: chatbotSns
nested_items.description: The Amazon SNS targets that Chatbot uses to notify the chat channel of updates to an incident. You can also make updates to the incident through the chat channel by using the Amazon SNS topics.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: displayName
nested_items.description: The long format name of the response plan. Can contain spaces.

nested_items.name: engagements
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the contacts and escalation plans that the response plan engages during an incident.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: incidentTemplate
nested_items.description: Details used to create the incident when using this response plan.

nested_items.name: dedupeString
nested_items.description: The string Incident Manager uses to prevent the same root cause from creating multiple incidents in the same account.

nested_items.name: impact
nested_items.description: The impact of the incident on your customers and applications.
1 - Critical.
2 - High.
3 - Medium.
4 - Low.
5 - No Impact.

nested_items.name: incidentTags
nested_items.description: Tags to assign to the template. When the StartIncident API action is called, Incident Manager assigns the tags specified in the template to the incident.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: notificationTargets
nested_items.description: The Amazon SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an incident.

nested_items.name: snsTopicArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.

nested_items.name: summary
nested_items.description: The summary of the incident. The summary is a brief synopsis of what occurred, what's currently happening, and context.

nested_items.name: title
nested_items.description: The title of the incident.

nested_items.name: integrations
nested_items.description: Information about third-party services integrated into the Incident Manager response plan.

nested_items.name: pagerDutyConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about the PagerDuty service where the response plan creates an incident.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the PagerDuty configuration.

nested_items.name: pagerDutyIncidentConfiguration
nested_items.description: Details about the PagerDuty service associated with the configuration.

nested_items.name: serviceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the PagerDuty service that the response plan associates with an incident when it launches.

nested_items.name: secretId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that stores your PagerDuty key, either a General Access REST API Key or User Token REST API Key, and other user credentials.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The short format name of the response plan. The name can't contain spaces.
